channel.title: I am unable to upgrade to SML: 2.1.0
channel.description: In version 1.0.8 how do i change to sml: 2.0.0 to sml: 2.1.0? I am unable to update

item.title: I am unable to upgrade to SML: 2.1.0
item.dc:creator: @JamieRCHI Jamie
item.description:
@JamieRCHI wrote:

The version of the application has nothing to do with the version of the applications it interfaces to. If they have an internal split in the code, I donâ€™t care. All I see is one program managing the interface to two separate build trees of Satisfactory. The internals of the code do not concern me. And as noted above, someone was needlessly confused because v2.0 is used for one thing, v2.1 another thing, and v1.0.x for a third. From now on I will only refer to the version 1.0.x version of the SML program and ignore the rest. (Except for the specific build numbers of Satisfactory of course.)

Read full topic
item.source: I am unable to upgrade to SML: 2.1.0

item.title: I am unable to upgrade to SML: 2.1.0
item.dc:creator: @Joel_Stead Joel Stead
item.description:
@Joel_Stead wrote:

I think they did it that way because the last few experimental releases have had big changes made to the core of them and they are trying to stabilize the mod launcher for both versions without it causing existing mods to stuff up massively. (Which is basically what has been happening with most mods in the last week or so.)

Read full topic
item.source: I am unable to upgrade to SML: 2.1.0

item.title: I am unable to upgrade to SML: 2.1.0
item.dc:creator: @JamieRCHI Jamie
item.description:
@JamieRCHI wrote:

They really need to fix the version thing. It is confusing. Worked at Microsoft for many years.
Never seen it done this way anywhere. One program, one version. That is how it is done.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Joel_Stead Joel Stead
item.description:
@Joel_Stead wrote:

2.1.0 Is for the experimental version, if your running the early access it will default to 2.0.0
